channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Watch live: Three new cases of Covid-19 in NZ, no further deaths
item.description: There have been two new confirmed cases reported in New Zealand, and one new probable case, with no further deaths from the coronavirus.

item.title: Housing market predicted to pick up as Covid-19 restrictions ease
item.description: After a period of hibernating over the lockdown period, the housing market could pick up again under alert level 3.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 28 April
item.description: Car repairers say work could take longer and cost more due to the Covid-19 outbreak. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest Covid-19 news.

item.title: Man charged after daylight assault on two people in Porirua
item.description: A 36-year-old man is appearing in Porirua District Court today charged with robbery and assault with intent to rape.

item.title: Work starts on $4 million Lansdowne Park sports hub
item.description: Work has kicked off on Blenheim's new multimillion-dollar sports hub only hours into New Zealand's first day at alert level 3.

item.title: Aucklanders draw up 'week's worth of takeaway options'
item.description: Some people are gearing up for a return to work, while others have been salivating at the prospect of their first takeaway in weeks. Aucklanders spell out what level 3 will mean for them.

item.title: Covid-19: New Zealand yet to define elimination despite officials' comments
item.description: New Zealand has been making international headlines overnight for "eliminating" Covid-19, but a public health expert says the country doesn't even have a definition of that yet.

item.title: Covid-19 rules postpones Cave Creek remembrance
item.description: Relatives of the victims of Cave Creek are unable to mark the 25th anniversary because of Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: Hunter charged with breaching lockdown rules
item.description: A Canterbury man has been charged with illegal hunting and breaching the lockdown after travelling more than 200km to hunt on Department of Conservation land.

item.title: Apec security bill amended after privacy concerns
item.description: Foreign security agents would have been free to intercept New Zealanders' cellphone calls under a bill paving the way for the Apec summit next year.

item.title: DHBs need to prioritise cancer treatment - Cancer Society
item.description: Up to 400 people could die from cancer if hospitals don't catch up quickly enough after the lockdown, the Cancer Society says.

item.title: Covid-19: Your alert level 3 travel questions answered
item.description: While level 3 allows a bit more movement for people, those anticipating a sojourn too far from their neighbourhood still need a very good reason to travel.

item.title: Queenstown migrant workers need access to benefit - community group
item.description: Community leaders say the full extent of the worker crisis in the Wakatipu has not reached its full extent, as they brace for more requests for food and clothing over the coming weeks.

item.title: Victoria University students organise rent strike to protest placeholder fee
item.description: A Facebook group set up by students to organise a rent strike protesting against a charge to allow them to hold on to hostel accommodation they cannot use has attracted more than 1000 members in 24 hours.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 27 April
item.description: On the final day under alert level 4, there were five new cases of Covid-19 in NZ and another death, while a contact tracing app gets closer and businesses gear up for level 3.

item.title: Lockdown breaches: 87 prosecutions over Anzac weekend
item.description: Police prosecuted 87 people for lockdown breaches over Anzac weekend, but have praised most New Zealanders for sticking to the alert level 4 restrictions.

item.title: One new confirmed case of Covid-19 today, but one further death
item.description: There has been just one new confirmed case of Covid-19 in New Zealand, and four new probable cases, but the death toll has now risen to 19. Watch the latest briefing here.

item.title: 'School is as safe as it's ever been' - infectious disease expert
item.description: Parents are being reassured that it is as safe as it has ever been to send children back to school.
